subtasks: Identify crops ready for harvest
Bend over to reach low-lying crops
Grasp crops and pull them from the ground
Bundle harvested crops into manageable sections
Walk through field to inspect soil conditions
Notice soil erosion or compaction issues
Discuss need for soil amendments or tillage
Walk to designated soil sampling points
Use shovel or trowel to dig small holes
Collect soil samples from different depths
Place samples in labeled containers
Use wheelbarrow to transport manure to field
Spread manure on the soil surface
Use rake or shovel to work manure into soil
Confirm even distribution of manure
Set up seeding machine
Load seeds into machine or hopper
Drive tractor while operating seeding equipment
Ensure proper depth and spacing of seeds
Check water pressure and flow from irrigation system
Adjust sprinkler or irrigation nozzle settings
Monitor water application across the field
Check for any leaks or clogs in irrigation system
Walk through the field to check plant health
Identify weeds or pest infestations
Hand pluck or apply herbicide to weeds
Prune or remove dead plant material
Identify representative areas of the field
Use trowel or hand tools to dig sample plots
Collect soil and plant samples for testing
Label samples with coordinates or location
Drive tractor to various field locations
Move equipment such as mowers, cultivators, or sprayers
Perform basic equipment checks and adjustments
